noun.description: The bobolink, Dolichonyx oryzivorus, flocks of which often frequent rice fields while on migration.
Any of various other birds, especially songbirds, (supposedly) found in rice fields.
The Java sparrow, Padda oryzivora (family Estrildidae), which frequents rice fields in Asia and is popular as a cage bird.

origin: Early 18th century (in an earlier sense). From rice + bird.
